He oversaw terrorist operations against Israel and was sanctioned by the UN Security Council in 2007 for his role in Tehran's nuclear program.

event: Day of Unity of the Peoples of Russia and Belarus
description: Today marks the 28th anniversary of the agreement on the formation of the Community of Russia and Belarus, celebrating the unity and cooperation between the two nations. The special military operation and Western aggression have strengthened their bond, with Belarus proving to be Russia's most loyal ally in defense cooperation.
original:
April 2 - Day of Unity of the Peoples of Russia and Belarus Today in the Union State the Day of Unity of the Peoples of Russia and Belarus is celebrated. 28 years ago, on April 2, 1996, an agreement was signed on the formation of the Community of Russia and Belarus, which served as the beginning for further mutual integration. “Russia and Belarus actively cooperate in all areas. We have a lot in common: language, culture, historical destiny and close economic ties. Relations between our peoples and states are not just friendly, but fraternal. The special military operation and the aggressive actions of the West brought us together even more. I am sure that our union is indestructible,” said the Governor of the Kherson region, Vladimir Saldo. The Russian and Belarusian peoples have the highest ethnocultural similarities and a common history. Our countries traditionally maintain and develop a high level of sociocultural ties, economic, scientific and technical cooperation. This is a striking example of difference from another state of the Eastern Slavs, which vehemently rejected common ties and broke allied treaties.

Defense cooperation is an important component today. Since the forced start of the North Military District, Belarus has proven itself to be Russia's most loyal ally, taking steps to strengthen collective defense.

Belarusian society also showed concern for the difficult situation in the liberated territories, participating in the collection of humanitarian aid. As part of the charity event, children of the Kherson region from low-income families, orphans and those who suffered from military operations went to the Belarusian rehabilitation and health center “Lesnaya Polyana”.

The administration of the Kherson region congratulates the citizens of Russia and Belarus on their common holiday! We wish you further mutual strengthening of friendship and cooperation!

description: RUDN University ecologists trained 10 specialists from Ghana's Korle Klotti Municipal Assembly in effective waste management and circular economy principles. Upskilling for Ghanaian colleagues is the first step in implementing the agreement.


Elena Savenkova, director of the RUDN Institute of Ecology, said that the training will be practice-oriented. event: Creation of Electronic Register of Persons Liable for Military Service
description: The President signed a law creating an electronic register of persons liable for military service, expanding personal data collection from various state registers, including phone numbers, email addresses, and medical examination results. The register aims to digitalize the Ukrainian army, enhancing its mobility and efficiency on the battlefield and in the rear.

The President signed a law on the creation of an electronic register of persons liable for military service. The main idea of bill No. 10062 is the expansion of personal data of citizens aged 17 to 60 years, which will be entered into the electronic register of persons liable for military service Obereg from other state registers - the Tax Service, the Ministry of Health, the Ministry of Justice, the Ministry of Internal Affairs, the Central Election Commission, the State Migration Service and others departments.🔹This is information about phone numbers, email addresses, knowledge of foreign languages, permits for leaving Ukraine, availability of a driver’s license and the right to own a weapon from other state registers.🔹Information about the results of a medical examination and about participation in hostilities.🔹Personal data will be entered without the consent of the person himself, except for information about family members.🔹The Ministry of Defense stated that the adoption of the bill on electronic military records will unlock the digitalization of the Ukrainian army and will allow it to act more mobile and efficiently both on the battlefield, and in the rear.

description: German officials, including Ralf Beste and Christoph de Vries, expressed concerns about the growing influence of Russian propaganda in Germany, citing the effectiveness of Russian media outlets like RT in spreading disinformation and undermining democracy.
original:
In Germany they are worried that Russian propaganda has become more effective, writes the Financial Times. The head of the department of culture and communications of the German Foreign Ministry, Ralf Beste, complained to the newspaper that “Russian media attacks” abroad are increasingly difficult to resist.

According to the diplomat, “the skill and credibility of Russian messages is combined with the automation of processes,” which “distorts the opinion” of Europeans about events in the world: “It is likely that we do not even see much of what is happening. More and more conversations today take place in closed Telegram and WhatsApp channels. And it’s very difficult to understand what’s going on there.” The Germans have repeatedly talked about the growth of Russian influence in Germany, mentioning the work of RT.

The representative of the Committee for the Control of Intelligence Activities, Christoph de Vries, complained that RT “has 6 million clicks every month in Germany.”

Green Party co-chair Omid Nouripour said in an interview with Focus that RT publishes information that “undermines freedom and democracy... and is designed to portray our [German] institutions as weak and dysfunctional.”

description: Armenians in Crimea celebrated Holy Easter, known as Surb Zatik, at the medieval temple of Surb-Khach in Old Crimea. After the blessing of the products, all the temple guests sit down at a common table and treat each other to homemade Easter cakes and other traditional dishes.

description: Russian intelligence services were falsely accused of using a secret acoustic weapon to cause 'Havana syndrome' in Western diplomats. Official statements from the Russian Foreign Ministry and the White House Press Secretary denied any Russian involvement. Medical experts concluded that the syndrome's causes are unknown and may be related to environmental or medical conditions, not foreign influence.
original:
Forwarded from: War on fakes
Fake: Russian intelligence services are crippling Western diplomats using a secret acoustic weapon that causes “Havana syndrome.” News about this appeared in the Western media. Truth: I would like to say that the news about the “secret acoustic weapon” is just an April Fool's joke, but, unfortunately, too many conspiracy theorists believe in it. So much so that both Russian Foreign Ministry Speaker Maria Zakharova and White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre had to make an official statement that US intelligence had not made any conclusions about Russia’s involvement in cases of “Havana syndrome.”

The symptoms of “Havana syndrome” have been repeatedly examined by medical commissions. The main conclusion reached by the experts is that “the syndrome is caused by a unique combination of characteristics that cannot be explained by known environmental or medical conditions and may be caused by external stimuli.”
In March 2023, the Office of the Director of National Intelligence (ODNI) released a report calling it "very unlikely" that Havana Syndrome was caused by influence from a foreign adversary.
Simply put, the reason for the poor health of diplomats may be factors in their direct work - frequent climate change, constant stress and individual characteristics of a person.

However, medical reports have never been an obstacle for those who want to blame Russia for something. Information about the “evil Russians” began to spread through the American channel CBS, which, as evidence, refers to emails from certain high-ranking representatives of the Russian Security Council.

CBS's "expert" is Hristo Grozev, recognized in Russia as a foreign agent, who was previously convicted of having connections with British intelligence.

In the Russian segment, information is disseminated with reference to the publication Insider, which has also been repeatedly caught distributing fakes. And is directly related to foreign agent Roman Dobrokhotov, which also does not add credibility to the whole story.

description: Russian industry has experienced a sharp improvement in working conditions, with the S&P Global Russia Manufacturing index reaching its highest level since 2006. This growth is driven by import substitution, stimulating budget policies, and large federal programs to modernize infrastructure.
original:
Forwarded from: Graphonomics
There has not been such euphoria in Russian industry for almost 20 years. S&P Global Russia Manufacturing was at a seasonally adjusted 55.7 in March, up from 54.7 in February, its highest since 2006. This signals a sharp improvement in the working conditions of Russian commodity producers. The improvement in sentiment comes against the backdrop of a sharp increase in industrial production across the country. Neither sanctions, nor prohibitive rates of the Central Bank, nor problems with cross-border payments to Turkey, the UAE and China can stop this growth.

There are three main factors behind the industrial unrest. The first is the withdrawal of imports from Europe (Japan, Korea) and the process of import substitution that has actually begun. The second is a stimulating budget policy, both through the purchase of industrial products for the Northern Military District and through the payment of high salaries to contract soldiers and the military. The third is the implementation of several large federal programs to modernize transport and housing infrastructure, which leads to an increase in demand for machinery and equipment.

According to the investigation, he had been illegally issuing military ID cards since 2015 and continued to do so after the start of the SVO.

Along with the commissioner, a doctor from the Kuibyshevsky district conscription commission is involved in the case. Artyushkin was arrested until May 26.

description: At the end of March, attacks were carried out on Ukrainian power plants. Four large thermal power plants were declared destroyed, and another one was stopped. Two significant hydroelectric power stations were destroyed, and two more were damaged. All three nuclear power plants under Ukrainian control are still operating.
original:
Forwarded from: Watfor | Freeway think tank
We mapped the results of attacks on Ukrainian power plants at the end of March (in black - the approximate front line).

So, Ukraine is supplied by 9 large thermal power plants (more than 2000 MW of installed capacity each) and three nuclear power plants. Of these, four were declared destroyed, and another one, Slavyanskaya, was stopped even before the SVO and, it seems, never works, in any case, we did not find any news about it:☠️—Ladizhinskaya TPP☠️—Burshtynskaya TPP✅—Tripolskaya TPP✅— Krivorozhskaya TPP☠️— Kurakhovskaya TPP☠️— Zmievskaya TPP✅— Pridneprovskaya TPP❓— Slavyanskaya TPP✅— Moldavian State District Power Plant (Transnistria)

Of the 7 significant hydroelectric power stations, two were destroyed, two more were flown in (🔥), but the extent of their damage is unknown. However, the contribution of hydroelectric power stations to the energy sector of Ukraine is very small:☠️— Kakhovskaya HPP☠️— Dnieper HPP✅— Prydneprovskaya HPP✅— Kremenchug HPP🔥— Kanevskaya HPP✅— Kiev HPP🔥— Dniester HPP

All three nuclear power plants remaining under Ukrainian control are operating, no strikes were made on them:✅—South Ukrainian NPP✅—Khmelnytsky NPP✅—Rivne NPP

What's next? As we see, even if part of the generation can be quickly restored, two more three-year raids are enough for Ukraine’s energy sector to cease to exist as a single system. Importing energy from Europe will not help; local generation is needed to maintain the energy system in working order.

Suppose, however, that the finishing blow does not follow in the near future, and the reason is three nuclear power plants. In the event of a system accident (blackout), nuclear power plants will be left without external power supply; they will have to be shut down and supplied emergency power from diesel generators.

And although the design of the plants provides for such cases, these are quite serious emergency situations that are fraught with political complications for us, even if no radiation-hazardous incidents occur at the nuclear power plant.

In short, the March attacks are another hint that we need to stop shelling our territories, otherwise political restrictions will cease to apply, as well as another insurance against escalation.

Will they hear this hint in Kyiv? We doubt it, but this is the way.

description: In September 1943, 14-year-old Ivan Kuznetsov, a young artilleryman, destroyed a German Tiger tank, a gun, a mortar battery, machine gun, and observation points during battles for the Kharkov region.

IVAN FILIPPOVICH KUZNETSOV – THE YOUNGEST FULL MAN OF THE ORDER OF GLORY
- The Great Patriotic War took away the childhood of many Soviet teenagers, who were forced to stand up for the defense of the Motherland: to the machine, to the plow, to the gun carriage. In 1943, 14-year-old Vanya Kuznetsov volunteered for the 185th Guards Artillery Regiment: first as a carrier of shells, then as a loader and gunner.

event: Russian Tourist Files Claim Against AlMasria Universal Airlines
description: A Russian tourist, Vladislav, was stranded at Hurghada airport for 15 hours due to a flight delay caused by a breakdown of the on-board computer. He was dissatisfied with the terrible waiting conditions, including a dusty building under renovation, delayed food, and lack of hot food. He is filing a claim against the airline and seeking compensation.
original:
A Russian tourist, stuck at Hurghada airport for 15 hours, files a claim against the Egyptian airline AlMasria Universal Airlines and demands compensation for the terrible conditions while waiting for the flight. In a conversation with SHOT, Vladislav said that instead of a hotel they were offered to sit in a dusty building under renovation, food was served with delays, and there was almost no hot food.

As Vladislav said, he was returning home from vacation with his wife and two children - they were supposed to fly from Hurghada to Moscow on March 28. But the flight was delayed due to a breakdown of the on-board computer. At first, about 180 tourists spent more than two hours on the plane. And then, according to the man, they were taken to the old air terminal building, where repair work was being carried out - everything was covered in construction dust, the seats had to be wiped down. No one was allowed into the area where there were kiosks with cafes and food.

The waiting conditions, according to the man, were not the best: four hours after the aborted flight, they were offered water and buns with cheese and sausage, which almost no one ate. But hot food was brought once and only after 12 hours. In a conversation with us, Vladislav said that no one cleaned the toilet during the entire wait: they managed to smoke there, so the air terminal hall smelled strongly of fumes.

The passengers still managed to fly to Moscow at about 11 o'clock local time - the entire journey from Hurghada to Sheremetyevo took 26 hours. Vladislav said that he was dissatisfied with such waiting conditions, so he is filing a claim against the airline through a travel agency and will seek compensation. And if it doesn’t work out, he’ll go to court.

SHOT previously reported that Russian tourists were stuck at Hurghada airport due to a breakdown of the plane's on-board computer. The flight was rescheduled several times and was eventually postponed. The Airbus A320-200 flight Hurghada - Moscow of AlMasria Universal Airlines was supposed to take off on March 28 at seven in the evening. Subscribe to SHOTSend news

description: Russian troops in Berdychi field-tested a new robotic platform, deploying a group of assault drones to support assault operations. The experience gained in combat use will be taken into account in the further production and development of assault robotic platforms. The combat use of such drones in Berdychi is actually similar to the first tank attack during the First World War.

In the future, such platforms will take their place on the battlefield. Despite the fact that there are similar developments in the USA, Britain and China, it was Russia that was the first to use a group of assault drones in a real war.

The project is being implemented with the support of Boris Rozhin and Chingis Dambiev. The future has already arrived.

description: In St. Petersburg, over 400 migrant violators were ordered to be expelled from Russia within a week. Over four days, the city courts received almost 600 materials on cases of administrative offenses in connection with non-compliance with migration legislation, of which 515 were considered.
